paper_metadata.title: Between 2013 and 2020, China implemented targeted poverty alleviation (TPA) policy that leads rural socioeconomic development to address poverty, and achieved the co-benefits of eliminating absolute poverty and narrowing the urban-rural income gap (URIG)

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Results show that TPA boosted the per capita disposable income of Chinese rural residents by 9.4% and contributed to more than 30% reduction in the county-level URIG
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: we used the difference in difference (DID) model and spatial Durbin model (SDM) to assess the impact of TPA on China's URIG

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: Between 2013 and 2020, China implemented targeted poverty alleviation (TPA) policy
evidence_citations.country_citation: Between 2013 and 2020, China implemented targeted poverty alleviation (TPA) policy
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: TPA policy had lifted approximately 80 million people out of poverty in less than eight years
